Definition;: a feeling of respect for and approval of somebody/something.;
the feeling that you have when you enjoy something that is funny or entertaining.;
the strong feeling that you have when something has happened that you think is bad and unfair.;
the feeling of being slightly angry.;
the feeling that somebody/something is good or acceptable; a positive opinion of somebody/something.
a feeling of interest and compassion for others.;

Emotion: confusion,"a state of not being certain about what is happening, what you should do, what something means, etc.";

Definition;: a strong desire to know about something.;
a strong wish to have or do something.;

Emotion: disappointment,"the feeling of being sad because something has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected or hoped.";
disapproval,"a feeling that you do not like an idea, an action or somebody's behaviour because you think it is bad, not suitable or going to have a bad effect on somebody.";
disgust,"a strong feeling of dislike for somebody/something that you feel is unacceptable, or for something that looks, smells, etc. unpleasant.";
embarrassment,"shy, awkward or guilty feelings;" a feeling of being embarrassed."""

Definition;: the state of feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm.;
the bad feeling that you have when you are in danger or when something bad might happen or when a particular thing frightens you.;
the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks.;

Emotion: grief,"a very sad feeling, especially when somebody dies.";

Definition;: a feeling of great happiness.;

Emotion: love,"a strong feeling of deep affection for someone or something, especially a member of your family or a friend.";

a feeling that good things will happen and that something will be successful.;
a feeling of deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements
column3: the achievements of those with whom one is closely associated
column4: or from qualities or possessions that are widely admired.;

a feeling of reassurance and relaxation following release from anxiety or distress.;
